results.title: My family
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Dotoi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: To Malcolm Dotoi, his family includes what he would call his extended family, his cousins and grandfather. They provide support, guidance and inspiration and have helped him to develop into a youth leader. His grandfather, a tribal elder, has taught Malcolm about his connection to the land and to the spiritual world and how all these things have contributed to who Malcolm is today.

results.title: My family
results.brief_description: Salma gives a first-hand account of being a refugee. Fleeing the conflict in Sudan, she talks about the pain and anxiety of her journey to Australia, as well as the gratitude she feels for her new country.

results.title: My fair lady (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The dazzling film version of Lerner and Loewe’s acclaimed musical. Audrey Hepburn stars as the cockney flowergirl Eliza Doolittle who is trained by Professor Higgins (Rex Harrison) to pass as a duchess. Featuring sumptuous cinematography and costumes by Cecil Beaton, this is one of the most popular musicals ever filmed. Winner of eight Academy Awards including Best Picture. The original musical is based on George Bernard Shaw’s “Pygmalion”.

results.title: My Fair Lady
results.brief_description: A snobbish phonetics professor agrees to a wager that he can take a flower girl and make her presentable in high society.

constellations_other.name: Sound and cinema
constellations_other.description: Beginning with one of the first films to be screened at the Palais (a Melbourne cinema with its own outstanding resident orchestra) the constellation celebrates sound as an integral part of the connection between moving image work and audience.

results.title: My Dreaming
results.brief_description: If you don’t know where you come from how do you know how to go forward? Look into the past, at women who have gone. Have their stories also gone with them?

results.title: My dog 'Number'
results.creator_credit: Paul Barralet and British Information Services
results.brief_description: A typical year in the life of David Murray, a Scottish sheep farmer, and of “Number”, his champion sheep-dog; filmed against pleasant Scottish hill-country, with interesting wildlife sequences, through the four seasons.

results.title: My dinner with Andre
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle, Beverly Karp, George W. George, Troma Productions, Andre Company and Saga Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the friendship of two real-life friends, actor Wallace Shawn and theatre director Andre Gregory, this surprisingly rivetting film consists mostly of a conversation. Dining out in an exclusive New York City restaurant, at the beginning, Shawn, like the viewer, is content to listen to Gregory’s astounding stories about experimental performance and rituals throughout the globe. For Andre, the mystical traditions of spirituality offer an optimism and integral meaning no longer possible in Western culture. The actor’s scepticism cannot be contained. By the time of the dessert he is countering Gregory’s insistence on the moral authority of spiritual cultures and making a defiant claim for the veracity and meaning of everyday urban culture. Reflecting the differing arguments at the centre of contemporary theatre - what is the function of performance; what is reality; does theatre (and Western philosophy in general) have a future - the conversation between the friends is stimulating, provocative and ultimately tender. This elegiac film, with a cast of two, filmed largely on one set, is a testament to Louis Malle’s refinement of the craft and artistry of filmmaking. Ultimately, however, the lasting treat of this film is how in restoring conversation and dialogue to the centre of philosophical speculation, it reinvigorates the ancient and consistent priorities of dialogue and argument.

results.title: My darling Clementine
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Samuel G. Engel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Considered one of the greatest westerns of all time, this is also Ford’s most consciously poetic western heavily overlaid with the weight of myth: the pitting of dark against light, wilderness against garden, paradise lost and then regained. A revenge plot culminating in the gunfight at the OK Corral is set against the leisurely and romantic portrayal of a period epitomised by the ritual celebration of community in the square dance. Henry Fonda plays Wyatt Earp, the wanderer planning to settle, the mover between worlds. The foil to Earp is the tragic figure of Doc Holliday (Victor Mature). Based on a book by Stuart N. Lake from a story by Sam Hellman. Cast also includes Linda Darnell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Ford, Samuel G. Engel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: My dad
results.creator_credit: Fan Chen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In China where they lived in rather poor conditions, Fan Chen’s father worked hard to support his family and provide a better life for them, eventually making the move to Australia in 2006. This story is a ‘thank you’ from his admiring son.
